page.title: 05SOUTH CLIFF OF HORNSEA
page.content: At{South Cliff}there is a{sea-defence structure called{"The Crib".}It is 92m long, 3m high, and 4m wide. It is made of big posts and old railway lines, which are filled in with boulders. On the beach there are a few old bricks and concrete slabs washed down from the cliffs.{Parts}of the{beach}are solid{clay. Caravans}are on the cliff-top. The{beach}consists of{sand 79%, {shingle}(<1cm){9%, pebbles}(1-5cm){4%, and{rock}(>5cm){8%.}We measured the length from the{cliff}to{low water as{100m. The{cliff}is{12.5m}high. The{clay}is darker at the bottom of the cliff. The earth on the cliff is{slumping}because the sea undermines the cliffs so that they collapse. This is how{lots of}the {cliffs}have{disappeared. John Christopher
